language.entry: The Flagellant relishes the scars and abrasions that cover his body - drawing incomprehensible resilience from the tearing of his own flesh. His flail, a particularly cruel and merciless weapon, drips with his enemies' blood...and his own.

Eschewing the company of others, the Flagellant turns his back to the fire, denying himself the comfort of its warmth. Instead, he whips himself mercilessly - this a man locked in perpetual battle with his own flesh and blood.

The Flagellant belongs to an extremist faction within the church, and is generally regarded with a toxic mixture of fear, awe, and disgust. The power he draws from martyrdom is as effective as it is unsettling - in one moment he is a fountain of healing renewal, and the next, a conduit of terrible wrath. His full potential is realized only the brink of madness...or death.
Immune to death by Crimson Curse
Something stirs within my body - what is this?!
I feel as if I've swallowed a handful of pins.
I feel a sharp burning inside.
My innards boil with venom and wriggling vermin!
I am pierced from inside by vermin's mandibles!
Something lives inside and I can feel it burrowing!
The burden is infinite. All flesh must perish.
As the burden grows, so too, does my purity.
I am blessed with new clarity!
Gladly do I accept this new trial! Blessed are the worthy!
Through pain and agony, I drag myself to the Light!
Blood washes my eyes and cleanses my vision!
In this fragile, broken flesh infinite strength is revealed!
What I once feared, I have become!
Adversity has dissolved my mortal psyche and opened my skull to the Light!
What is fear but a key to piety?
Through pain, through agony - I drag myself to the Light!
Blood washes my eyes and cleanses my vision, for the Light I suffer!
It falls to me to guide you back to the Light.
Resist not the burden for it will guide you better than any compass.
I do not attack you. It is the light that seeks to purify you.
Don't you see? The pain eases the burden.
I envy the free flow of your blood.
The burden must be borne by all!
Purity guides my every act, shrink not from my blows!
Clear this mind. Clear this mind. Clear this mind.
The light must burn brighter if we are to persist!
Begone foul visions, flee before my flowing blood!
I am set upon by tempting visions! Light guide me!
I hesitated upon the path. Let the blood soothe my faith!
First the sacred wound, then the purifying salt, then the holy stitch.
Pain cleaves away the basest instincts!
Suffering is the vessel into which I pour my blood!
Wounds…not a setback…beacons for the Light.
Sense the Light… behind all fates.
The Light shrinks from my inner vision and so follows my faith.
So grows the burden! So grows my strength!
Behold - the Light shines from my wounds!
I see you all as profane corpses. A righteous fate for those who fear pain.
Must the burden weigh on my mind as well as my body?
I no longer need to be tested! See how I shine!
Weaklings! Wear your wounds with honor!
This one greets pain with arms wide open!
I am the sun of salvation!
I can show you the points where the pain sings most sweetly!
To heal a wound is to fail the lesson.
…and this holy man flayed himself with a single prolonged cut and so he ascended…
Pain is the Light's song, and agony is its blessing.
Has anyone seen my prayer caltrops?
Who will sponge me with vinegar?
I grieve when wounds clot and close, but rejoice at their re-opening.
I trust my screams will not disturb your slumber.
True strength is drawn from the burden.
I am one with the weight, its strength flows through me.
I cannot lean on another or I will lose the way!
Hunger is but another step on the path.
To satiate desire is to bow to the beast inside.
It is time to bleed, not time to eat.
Gluttony darkens the Light and muddies the way.
If you cannot see the Light then gouge your eyes!
Worthless! Anyone can see you have shirked your burden.
The way requires the flow of blood.
Why lighten the burden? Why deprive the soul?
How dare you try to silence my choir of wounds?!
Make yourself useful and pass me the salt.
The flesh is mortal, embrace this and live forever.
We must not stray from the path.
Into rivers of blood this broken flesh must drown.
We have feared thus the Light flickers and wanes.
Do not pull me from this holy path!
To flee is to abandon all faith!
I cannot waver, this flesh will be delivered!
Without blood there is no true salvation.
This burden cannot be set aside.
I must bear the burden - the weight of my sin.
I will not flee these blows!
This is a trial of faith!
Strength flows to those who stand with faith!
Aside cur! I must follow my path!
I will shoulder your burden too, impious one.
This is the way, will you stop me?
I know it makes no sense to you, ye who bears such little weight.
It is here I seek the answers through pain.
The burden only seeks to increase itself and I strive to ensure this happens.
Fall behind me and test your flesh! Salvation can yet still find you.
Sheep to the back! I am the shepherd!
Into the fire! I must purify myself in the crucible of faith!
See me Light! Witness how I shrink not from the burden!
"Through holy agony, bear thy impure flesh forward into the rending knives of the heretics!"
"The way is found where the weapon cleaveth the flesh and lo it is worthy! Blood be thine true sign!"
Anyone with true humility would advance with me!
Travels along the way… blood will flow…
Where the way leads… pain… certain…
Agony… pain… holy trials… each step…
Where faith goes, the blood must follow!
Each wound is a prayer heard!
I wait, ready for the burden!
Another test. I will not waiver.
Have I strayed? Light guide me!
Guided by pain! Favoured by the Light!
Flee from the holy bearer, you impious fiends!
Blood for the burden! Bones for the Light!
You disturb the litanies of the blood.
"There will be those who tempteth the flesh into releasing the burden."
You have hallowed your soul unto the darkness.
We each have our own burden to bear, unto Death and the valley beyond.
I stand where the Light shines pure!
I've waited long for this! DON'T TAKE IT FROM ME.
Whose will is so pure as to presume command?
The corrupt flesh rots the mind. Light guide me then!
I have studied my scars and divined the way, have you?
All wounds lead to the Light!
Reason is too weak to bear any burden! Release it!
Warning! Current contagion level in this facility:
"They're everywhere! Crush the invading insects to earn Invitations to the Courtyard!"
Curse-carrying insects have begun to spread over the Estate!
"All is quiet. The swarms have receded to the swampy ruins of the Courtyard."
Leave enough Blood for them, or they may die!
I am the fury! I will drink from my enemies!
The Blood! I must have the Blood!
Get infected by the Crimson Curse
Lose a hero to Wasting Away from the Curse
Kill an ally (via attack_friendly act out) while under the Curse
Contract the Crimson Curse via contagion
Have your entire roster affected by the crimson curse
ALL MUST BLEED! IT IS THE WAY!
GIVE IT TO ME, I KNOW YOU HAVE IT!
You are keeping The Blood for yourself, aren't you!
Do not deny me what I need to survive!
I asked nicely before, I just really need some Blood.
Please just a small taste! Do not make me drain your veins dry!
I made every reasonable offer possible, and look at what you just made me do.
Interest gained on saved gold: %d%% per week.
I have been chosen to suffer, so suffer I must!
Let all foulness be purged from my sacred flesh!
I find comfort in the pain...
AWASH IN CRIMSON! I AM REBORN!
AM I HUMAN OR MERELY A VESSEL FOR THE BLOOD?!
MY LIFE FOR THE CRIMSON FLUID!
The craving itself speaks through me.
I know not what I've become but I know what I need!
I shall surely perish of this thirst!
Gods have mercy! I am practically hollow!
It feels as though sand pushes through my veins...
DO NOT TAINT THE PURITY OF THE STRENGTH THE BLOOD GIVES ME!
As if encouragement and magics will help! Only The Blood!
True strength can only come from the Blood!
Those benefits are ephemeral and will eventually betray me!
But will it soothe my thirst?
I will be dead of thirst soon anyway.
Nothing could overcome this thirst I feel.
Disgusting! Have you any of The Blood, though?
It simply won't fill me up like the Blood does.
What dross, how dull everything tastes once one has sampled the exquisite Blood!
Is it Blood..? Oh nevermind then.
Would you mind if I just nicked your wrist instead? Oh well then...
WE MUST FLOOD THIS PLACE WITH BLOOD!
HA! I NEED NOTHING! THE BLOOD COURSES THROUGH ME!
WHAT FOR?! I AM FULL TO THE BRIM OF CRIMSON NECTAR!
I ALREADY SURGE WITH THE BLOOD'S VITALITY!
The only thing that will restore me is The Blood!
All that supports me now is the Blood!
I would rather thirst forever than accept any inferior nourishment.
Useless. Give me only my red nectar...please.
Much appreciated, but come back when you have some Blood.
I have not the strength. Only an infinite thirst...
No, please, you go ahead. I must rest.
I am simply not interested, unless you think there is Blood to be had...
%d bottles of The Blood brewed each week.
Idle stress relief in town increased by %d per week.
HERE I WILL STRIKE FOR BLOOD!
I CAN SMELL WHERE BLOOD WILL BE SPILLED!
What is that sweet smell that sings to my very veins?
Stand aside! I must slake my thirst!
I WILL TASTE YOU AND NOTHING WILL STOP ME!
Mmmmmm the wondrous smell of a wound!
Oh gods! That odour! That aroma of freshly spilled Blood!
Please just a taste! You're already injured!
I must see if there's any Blood hidden here!
Blood?! Could there be some here?
It must have The Blood hidden within. I pray...
Please let there be Blood, even the tiniest drop.
Forgive me but I must make absolutely sure there's no Blood.
Oh! I was not myself for a moment...
So hungry... I didn't even notice...
I fear my thirst has made my footing unstable.
I am just so tired, please end it now!
It is hopeless, I will never drink Blood again.
Have other heroes braved these swamps and marshes before you?
The mists can lead you to unexpected, dangerous places.
A well-timed dose of The Blood goes a long way.
Fire is an effective tool against insects.
Eating bananas is a surefire way to get swarmed by mosquitos.
You might find new uses for torches in Courtyard raids.
Sometimes a nip of laudanum is enough to keep the Horror at bay.
The Crimson Curse does offer certain advantages to savvy adventurers.
Defeat the Statue guardian to claim powerful trinkets.
The Courtyard is now unlocked for further adventures.
Thorns hook into the flesh, a cloying sap seeps into your wound!
These blossoms bear the stench of pestilence and unfathomable nightmares!
The wilting gives off a noxious odour!
You find treasure in the disgusting blood and soil!
These ghoulish flowers have nothing to offer.
A map is nestled between the thorns!
The flowers surge with growth! But the blood invites no other occurence.
The cloth protects your delicate flesh!
Your blood is tainted with a strange infection!
You cut your finger on a mandible.
These bones offer no further clues or loot.
The hero's scars weep and open when bathed in the crimson fluid!
The purified liquid offers a surprising boon!
Treasure lies in the gore-filled basin!
Burning the blood stings the nostrils and turns the stomach.
Gestating creatures burst forth from the eggs!
Disgusting viscera... and not much else.
Sweet relief as the eggs turn to ash.
There is nothing but rot inside the seemingly fresh morsels!
There are valuables scattered about the repast.
Precise use of herbs and oils purifies what is edible.
There remains nothing worthy of your time.
A side compartment springs open! What lies inside?
You picture debauched and bloody games...
What sadist put treasure in its skull?
The hive's inhabitants sting and bite!
You deftly tease out some valuables.
The vermin sizzle and pop as it burns.
The shrew's claws are like iron!
It does not react to your search.
The shrew is incoherent and penniless.
The shrew gifts you with treasure!
The shrew's claws are like iron!
The urchin's arcane mutterings stir deep terror within!
Seeing no reaction, you pilfer this creatures belongings.
The urchin does not seem to notice you.
You are certain to put this to good use!
Take more care sorting through broken glass!
There is loot in the broken glass!
Nothing but broken glass and wood splinters.
A sip uncorks a disturbing new habit!
You find a map in an empty bottle!
This chest holds a key needed for this adventure.
The soil is soaked with half-clotted blood.
A heap of peculiar bones and dusty sinew litters the floor.
A burbling fount spews crimson ichor from some damnable source.
Shifting and bulging organisms hide behind translucent walls.
An anachronistic mixture of both rotted and fresh victuals adorn the cart.
Mouldering evidence of a society's depravity.
The hive is twisted and unnatural - the work of cursed vermin.
The hive is twisted and unnatural - the work of cursed vermin.
This appears to be an elderly but shunned member of this damned court.
A mysterious figure, not fully human, not fully insect, kneels here on the ground.
This chest must hold some kind of loot.
You can see that some of the bottles are still intact.
This chest holds a key needed for this adventure.
A long-forgotten lockbox sits on the cold stone floor, its contents unknown.
Some poor adventurer caught and shackled.
This chest holds a key needed for this adventure.
You are sure this box holds something worthy of your accomplishments!
This chest holds a key needed for this adventure.
You pry the lid open successfully...
You destroy the chest and its contents the attempt to force it open.
The key safely unlocks the chest, disarming any trap!
Inside you will find a very useful key.
It couldn't hurt to poke at these harmless remains...
The flowing blood fountain is strangely hypnotic...
Perhaps you could find something here to lend strength to your journey?
You hope this will do the trick...
What's the worst that could happen?
What forgotten empire left these treasures in the dust?
Fuel for debaucherous intrigue and debased revelry.
Inside you fill find a very useful key.
Free this one to bolster your ranks!
Inside you fill find a very useful key.
Your fingers itch to prise the lid open!
Inside you fill find a very useful key.
wasted away from the Crimson Curse, for lack of The Blood.
drank The Blood, but it destroyed their pure body.
What lies beyond this shackled portal?
{?hero_names}%s sojourned to pillage the Courtyard and dismantle the Guardian Statue. ({?difficulty}%s {?length}%s)
{?hero_names}%s set out to find the Courtyard mentioned in the invitation. ({?difficulty}%s {?length}%s)
{?hero_names}%s set out to defeat the Baron. ({?difficulty}%s {?length}%s)
{?hero_names}%s set out to defeat the Viscount. ({?difficulty}%s {?length}%s)
{?hero_names}%s set out to defeat the Countess. ({?difficulty}%s {?length}%s)
As the sacrificial pyre is damaged, the Fanatic's zealous rages increase!
The Fanatic is especially damaging to heroes with the Crimson Curse.
Scarred by some past encounter, the Fanatic relentlessly scours the estate in his quest to expunge the Curse.
Some food is granted for free each week.
ONLY COME TO ME WITH BLOOD OR BEGONE!
I SWOON WITH THE PUNGENT AROMA OF BLOOD EVERYWHERE!
I am reduced to pure desire, a fire that cleanses reason!
Hold! It transfixes my every nerve!
Too faint... but have you any Blood?
Give me some Blood and I'll consider it.
The burden of suffering cannot be shared!
An invitation to an evening of games and entertainment. Signed 'The Baron'
'We have a place of honour for you in the banquet hall' -The Viscount
Delicate script inviting you to dance affixed with the Countess' royal seal.
The call is unyielding; the urge is irresistable. Only the Blood will quell this thirst.
Its origins and ingredients unknown, but this tincture will quell the Curse.
Only through rage will the passage open.
Can pure regret make the way clear to proceed?
Plod on and pretend. It'll take you further.
The way unlocks when you consider your weaknesses, not strengths.
A special torch, twice wrapped in cloth and soaked in sulphurous compounds.
"It will be mine - whatever the cost!"
"I will forget them. Regret is sin."
"Even the Chief was in on it."
"I fear the whispers of my mind!"
Menacing mists rise eerily from the marsh eager to confuse hapless travellers.
Proof that a much grander structure once stood in these swamps.
%d additional Respite Points if you have at least one Abomination, Hellion, or Leper in your party.
The courtyard has been sealed for uncountable years.
The malignant merrymaking continues - and you are the entertainment!
The Viscount has set the table...
At last the Countess reveals herself!
It burns me through to my very soul!
The flames rise! Hurry and free me!
Please good heroes, release me from these chafing shackles!
I owe you a debt of gratitude for your kindness.
%s, a valiant %s was rescued and returned safe to the Hamlet!
The blood! I must have the blood!
Without the blood, I shall perish...
I WILL DO ANYTHING FOR IT!!! ANYTHING!!!
I AM LOST IN THE THROES OF ITS ECSTASY!
{?hero_names}%s were not a match for the Guardian. ({?difficulty}%s {?length}%s)
{?hero_names}%s crumbled the Guardian and plundered the Courtyard! ({?difficulty}%s {?length}%s)
{?hero_names}%s were overwhelmed by the Courtyard minions trying to burn the hives!. ({?difficulty}%s {?length}%s)
{?hero_names}%s were unable to defeat the Baron. ({?difficulty}%s {?length}%s)
{?hero_names}%s beat the Baron at his own game! ({?difficulty}%s {?length}%s)
{?hero_names}%s were unable to slay the Viscount. ({?difficulty}%s {?length}%s)
{?hero_names}%s were unable to defeat the Countess. ({?difficulty}%s {?length}%s)

The {colour_start|town_activity_log_building_name}Abbey{colour_end} is a place for reflection, introspection, and now: even infection. {colour_start|notable}{?hero_name}%s{colour_end} now has {colour_start|harmful}{?quirk_name}%s{colour_end}.
A toast to strange fellows and dark temptations. {colour_start|notable}{?hero_name}%s{colour_end} now has {colour_start|harmful}{?quirk_name}%s{colour_end}.
Shared linens and shared cravings. {colour_start|notable}{?hero_name}%s{colour_end} now has {colour_start|harmful}{?quirk_name}%s{colour_end}.
The lash may purge the soul, but it invites shared blood. {colour_start|notable}{?hero_name}%s{colour_end} now has {colour_start|harmful}{?quirk_name}%s{colour_end}.
The dice tell their own tale. {colour_start|notable}{?hero_name}%s{colour_end} now has {colour_start|harmful}{?quirk_name}%s{colour_end}.
Avoiding dangers is no prevention from catching what's going around. {colour_start|notable}{?hero_name}%s{colour_end} now has {colour_start|harmful}{?quirk_name}%s{colour_end}.
The mind alone cannot overcome all infections. {colour_start|notable}{?hero_name}%s{colour_end} now has {colour_start|harmful}{?quirk_name}%s{colour_end}.
All are welcome at the pews. Maybe they shouldn't be. {colour_start|notable}{?hero_name}%s{colour_end} now has {colour_start|harmful}{?quirk_name}%s{colour_end}.

Bring madness into the {colour_start|town_activity_log_building_name}Sanitarium{colour_end}, bring madness out. {colour_start|notable}{?hero_name}%s{colour_end} now has {colour_start|harmful}{?quirk_name}%s{colour_end}.

Bring madness into the {colour_start|town_activity_log_building_name}Sanitarium{colour_end}, bring madness out. {colour_start|notable}{?hero_name}%s{colour_end} now has {colour_start|harmful}{?quirk_name}%s{colour_end}.

Many come and go in the {colour_start|town_activity_log_building_name}Tavern{colour_end}, occasionally leaving something behind. {colour_start|notable}{?hero_name}%s{colour_end} now has {colour_start|harmful}{?quirk_name}%s{colour_end}.

Bring madness into the {colour_start|town_activity_log_building_name}Sanitarium{colour_end}, bring madness out. {colour_start|notable}{?hero_name}%s{colour_end} now has {colour_start|harmful}{?quirk_name}%s{colour_end}.
{colour_start|notable}{?hero_name}%s{colour_end} wasted away from the Crimson Curse, for lack of The Blood.
{colour_start|notable}{?hero_name}%s{colour_end} has come down from the bloodlust.
{colour_start|notable}{?hero_name}%s{colour_end} has controlled the urges of their Crimson Curse...for now.
{colour_start|notable}{?hero_name}%s{colour_end} is now wasting away from the Crimson Curse. They need The Blood!
{colour_start|notable}{?hero_name}%s{colour_end} drank a vial of The Blood and their thirst is slaked.
A monument, with no purpose except proclamation of one's dedication.
It would seem his taste for triviality remains unabated, even now.
The jig is up. The game is done.
What games does the diminutive fool play at now?
The corpulant braggart could never eat his fill. Let him dine on sharpened steel tonight.
The glutton's taste for morbidity is made more pronounced by his mutation.
Let us hope he enjoyed his last meal, served cold as it was.
The Countess arrives! Anomalous in aspect, and bent on exacting terrible revenge from beyond the bounds of decency!
Where I failed, you have succeeded, and the world is better for it
Even my untethered imagination dares not conceive of what effect the years spent submerged in toxic sludge
may have had on her heteromorphic flesh.
Soaked and sinking, these stone terraces and sprawling gardens were the site of long forgotten revelry, and well-remembered regret.
The maddening whine of multitudinous wings abates. Let us hope that is the end of things.
A hideous mutation - unnatural and abhorrent!
The flames of the smouldering pyre dance in his eyes dance with murderous zeal!
You are not alone in this place. The Fanatic is on the prowl, and he smells your sickness.
The whimpering dog flees to his kennel!
The hamlet cannot stand for this thing that should not be - defeat it! Claim the prize it guards!
It crumbles for now, but I fear there may be no end to this blood-borne evil.
The very grounds themselves are animated by a deep-rooted evil, a cosmic hatred for all that thrive beyond its tainted grasp.
Just as I feared. Now loosed from their brackish prison, they will spread like locusts across our land.
A fresh irritation to some. A sanguine memory to me.
The Courtyard and gardens surrounding the Manor were once a point of pride for the diligent custodians I employed.
Great banquets and lavish social affairs were hosted here, under the stars. Despite the expectation of propriety normally ascribed to those in our position,
we mocked the stoic melancholy of the moss covered fountains and cherubic statues. Our salacious trysts half-hidden in the hedgerows;
our morality slipping ever deeper... into the mud.
They would arrive in teeming hordes, adorned in powdered wigs and pretension - seeking to slake their thirst on wine and indecency.
As intoxication invariably took hold, innocuous frivolities would escalate to ever more disturbing diversions.
Orchestrating the hideous affair was a hunchbacked fiend who seemed to delight in proportion to the suffering he caused. I could have stopped him, I suppose,
but I was a slave to my own appetites, and restraint would have rendered me a hypocrite.
The feasting and revelry would last for weeks at a time. Great stone tables were set with such an abundance of rare delicacies
that we would stuff ourselves until the exotic became mundane. When the lavish spread began to spoil,
a ravenous gourmand gleefully proposed that we sample from the fetid pile of composting refuse!
The notion was dismissed as decidedly unhealthy, but days later he was found cackling madly atop a heap of rancid comestibles, licking his fingers in delight.
Madness can take many forms, but none so contemptible as man's belief in a mythology of his own making.
A world view buttressed by dogmatic desperation invariably leads to single-minded fanaticism, and a need to do terrible things in the name of righteousness.
This man is an animal - rabid, destructive, and incapable of nuanced understanding. He must be put down.
These swarming fiends carry a pernicious plague. A sickness so virulent - so insidious - it is more a curse than a mere disease!
The rusted, moss covered gates of the Courtyard hang open, but the demoniacal pests
will spread no further than its blood-soaked boundaries. And so at last, the end of my beginning.
The virulent clouds from the Courtyard have abated. The airs of the Estate feel...narrowly agreeable once again.
"Awash in blood and delusion, they bear the burden of a thousand lifetimes."
An unfamiliar wind caresses the hills and slips through even the deepest of caverns...is that hope?
The virulent clouds from the Courtyard have abated. The airs of the Estate feel...narrowly agreeable once again.
These swarming fiends carry a pernicious plague. A sickness so virulent - so insidious - it is more a curse than a mere disease!
Dire circumstances are rarely remedied with fear and fanaticism, and yet... here we are.
Dire circumstances are rarely remedied with fear and fanaticism, and yet... here we are.
Dire circumstances are rarely remedied with fear and fanaticism, and yet... here we are.
Dire circumstances are rarely remedied with fear and fanaticism, and yet... here we are.
Awash in blood and delusion, he bears the burden of a thousand lifetimes
Though long years may seek to separate them, action and consequence will invariably have their dreadful reunion.
A fresh irritance to some. A sanguine memory to me.
Though long years may seek to separate them, action and consequence will invariably have their dreadful reunion.
There is power in the Blood, for those with the fortitude to pay the price.
Awash in blood and delusion, they bear the burden of a thousand lifetimes
Unsettling in the extreme, several of the church's more zealous advocates have wandered into the Hamlet in search of a glorious death. We hope they find it quickly.
The light seems to be rallying against the evil energies that cloak the region, finding its way into the deepest recesses and providing a fleeting advantage to the active militia.
Waves of relief wash over the Hamlet as the good news spreads: The Countess is dead, and her Curse is now curable.
An excommunicated madman has responded to the growing infestation in kind. Fueled by conviction, he is merciless, and plies his trade with extreme prejudice.
An excommunicated madman has responded to the growing infestation in kind. Fueled by conviction, he is merciless, and plies his trade with extreme prejudice.
An excommiunicated madman has responded to the growing infestation in kind. Fueled by conviction, he is merciless, and plies his trade with extreme prejudice.
There are some who believe that only a litany of blood and suffering can cleanse sickness in the land. Here is one who will do his part.
Intolerable! Clouds of mosquitos and other, less identifiable pests continue to descend upon the Hamlet with maddening persistence! Illness and irritation abound.
A crumbling stone entry to a forgotten labyrinthian garden has been uncovered! The discoverer, sadly, has perished from innumerable insect stings. Concern rises.
The haze of contagion has abated, due in no small part to the recent triumph over the age-old horror that had lurked for too long behind the long-sealed Courtyard gate.
The Hamlet has been restored to a livable level of degeneracy once more. The dispersal of this pestilence to the surrounding environs, however, seems inevitable...
Torchlight dims much more slowly this week.
Removes the CRIMSON CURSE from all affected heroes. CRIMSON CURSE is also now treatable at the Sanitarium.
The Fanatic will stalk parties with infected heroes.
The Fanatic will stalk parties with infected heroes.
The Fanatic will stalk parties with infected heroes.
Stress reduction activities in town are slightly less effective.
Removes the CRIMSON CURSE from all affected heroes.
All regions will experience a growing infestation...
Not enough Blood in your Estate. Some wasting heroes in town may die. Proceed?
Explore the ruins of the Courtyard and prevent the Guardian from escaping!
Explore the ruins of the Courtyard and prevent the Guardian from escaping!
The Hamlet is afflicted with a plague of winged pests! Brave the swampy ruins of the Courtyard and torch their monstrous colonies.
The Baron invites you to join his twisted games...
The Viscount invites you to a loathsome dinner...
The Countess commands an audience...perhaps she wishes one last dance?
Explore the ruins of the Courtyard and prevent the Guardian from escaping!
Explore the ruins of the Courtyard and prevent the Guardian from escaping!
Venturing into the Courtyard will consume 1 Invitation...
You do not possess any Invitations! You are barred from entry.
You are cordially invited to the Courtyard...
Entry to the Courtyard requires an Invitation!
I've failed... I cannot bear it.
The Blood! I must have the Blood!
The Blood! I must have the Blood!
The Blood! I must have the Blood!
was burned to death at the stake.
was burned to death at the stake.
I could sense in her a mocking thirst.
I plotted to rid myself of this lurking threat
in a grand display of sadistic sport.
But, as the moment of murder drew nigh,
The gibbous moon revealed her inhuman desires
and I set to work pursuing degeneracy
as I revealed the unnatural terroir of the house vintage.
But my exhaltation was cut short
as the attending gentry turned upon themselves
in an orgy of indescribable frenzy.
A single drop of that forbidden tannin
gifted me with a dizzying glimpse
of the hibernating horror beneath my feet.
I understood the terrible truth of the world.
I stood reborn, molted by newfound knowledge.
My head throbbing to the growing whine of winged vermin
come to drink the tainted blood

{?hero_names}%s went to gather the Blood in the Courtyard, to help ease the suffering of those Cursed. ({?difficulty}%s {?length}%s)
{?hero_names}%s were unable to complete gathering all of The Blood in the Courtyard. Woe to the Cursed! ({?difficulty}%s {?length}%s)
{?hero_names}%s returned with The Blood from the Courtyard, much to the relief of those woeful Cursed heroes. ({?difficulty}%s {?length}%s)
The Cursed heroes shake, whinge and plea for more Blood! This accursed fluid can only be found reliably in the Courtyard - seek crates marked for the Winemaker's Reserve.

The Cursed heroes shake, whinge and plea for more Blood! This accursed fluid can only be found reliably in the Courtyard - seek crates marked for the Winemaker's Reserve.
Bottles of The Blood disguised as wine.
I must gather what little I have left...
Hee hee hee - The Blood is within me!
Touch me not - I am on the hunt!
I will yield no quarter till I am sated!
Yesss - behold the power of The Blood!
Gestating creatures burst forth from the eggs!
Shifting and bulging organisms hide behind translucent walls.
